subject: Business
title: The Endowment Effect: Owning Changes Value
description: A fast breakdown of The Endowment Effect: Owning Changes Value for builders.

hook.text: Students given a coffee mug wanted $7.12 to sell it. Others offered only $2.87 to buy it. Same mug, different value.

buildup.text: The endowment effect means people value things more simply because they own them.

discovery.text: Free trials exploit this: once you use the product for 30 days, giving it up feels like a loss.

twist.text: Even virtual ownership works. Test drives, 'add to cart,' and customization tools all create psychological ownership.

climax.text: IKEA's 'build it yourself' furniture feels more valuable precisely because you assembled it.

punchline.text: Let them hold it. Once it's theirs, they won't let go.

quiz.question: Why do free trials increase conversion rates?
options: Using the product creates ownership feelings that make cancellation feel like a loss
Free products are always higher quality
People forget to cancel before the trial ends
